rationales.hedonism: She gives up personal comfort and break time to support a vulnerable patient.
rationales.universalism: She takes extra steps to help an uninsured homeless patient secure warmth and shelter.
Her criticism centers on patient care harms from cost-cutting rather than institutional rewards.

rationales.hedonism: She stays late and absorbs emotional strain instead of preserving her own comfort.
rationales.universalism: She prioritizes equitable care for a refugee family and objects to missing language access resources.
She focuses on systemic injustice in mental health and addiction care for uninsured families.

rationales.hedonism: She commits weekend time and energy to difficult resettlement work despite burnout pressures.
rationales.universalism: She remains engaged in refugee support amid funding cuts and discriminatory housing barriers.

rationales.hedonism: She rejects prioritizing her own personal-life comfort in favor of continued care focus.
rationales.universalism: Her response indicates sustained commitment to broader social-care obligations over self-focus.

rationales.self_direction: She deliberately reframes her approach and chooses to pursue systemic rather than habitual responses.
rationales.universalism: She links ecological restoration and healthcare inequity to improving conditions for people and communities.
